CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Device parameters , such as J SC , V OC , FF , and PCE are deduced from the J-V characteristics and summarized in Table 3.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| J SC |
| V OC |
| FF |
| PCE |

In this paragraph, the terms "J SC", "V OC", "FF", and "PCE" are mentioned as device parameters that are deduced from the J-V characteristics. These terms are likely abbreviations for more descriptive names, but as they are presented in the text, they are the "Material Name" entities that we are tasked with identifying.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| J SC |
| V OC |

In this revised paragraph, only the terms "J SC" and "V OC" are mentioned as device parameters that are deduced from the J-V characteristics. These terms are likely abbreviations for more descriptive names, but as they are presented in the text, they are the "Material Name" entities that we are tasked with identifying.

The terms "FF" and "PCE" were removed as they do not clearly refer to material names. "FF" is likely an abbreviation for "fill factor," which is a parameter used in the calculation of solar cell efficiency, but it is not a material name. "PCE" is likely an abbreviation for "power conversion efficiency," which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell, but it is not a material name.
